abstract: Despite a strong start that yielded four blockbuster transactions in one week, the first half of 2013 was the slowest first six months for mergers in four years.
snippet: Despite a strong start that yielded four blockbuster transactions in one week, the first half of 2013 was the slowest first six months for mergers in four years.
lead_paragraph: A long-awaited rebound in mergers is taking its time to arrive. But for all the hand-wringing by bankers and lawyers, the business of arranging deals has not quite disappeared yet.

headline.main: Merger Activity Was Down but Not Out in First Half
headline.print_headline: Despite Early Big Deals, First Half of 2013 Was Slowest for Mergers in 4 Years

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
